text.section:
The Archives may allow a unit of local government or its designee to have custody of an original local record if the unit or designee:
demonstrates that the unit or designee will preserve the record adequately; and
deposits with the Archives or permits the Archives to make a security microform copy of the record.

The Archives may not destroy a local record unless the Archives:
offers the record to the appropriate local government or its designee; and
the government or designee declines to accept the record.
